page.title: 05Glenisla School.
page.content: Glenisla School is a one-teacher rural school and it is completely surrounded by countryside. The school consists of two separate buildings. The main building has two classrooms and toilet facilities. It was built in 1958 and has full oil-fired central heating. The main building materials are brick and timber. The other building is much older and was originally the school itself. It is now used as a general purpose room. We watch television, eat our lunch and do gym there. This building is joined to the schoolhouse in which the schoolteacher lives. These buildings are stone-built. There is a fairly big playground surrounding the school. About half the area is grass-covered and the remainder is hard-surfaced. There is a shelter shed for protection in inclement weather.
